meanings.definition: Romeo - a lover, especially a man who is ardent and passionate in his affections.
meanings.sent1: The young man wrote love letters to his sweetheart, proving he was one of the romeos in town.
meanings.sent2: In the play, Romeo's love for Juliet is a classic example of a romantic romeo.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends teased John, calling him one of the romeos because of his constant flirting.
meanings.sent4: His heart beat like a drum, echoing the passion of the romeos in the old tales.
meanings.sent5: She could see the fire of love burning in his eyes, just like in the stories of the romeos of old.

meanings.sent1: One of the romeos at the party introduced himself as Romeo, causing a few chuckles.
meanings.sent2: Romeo's parents named him after the famous character from Shakespeare's play.
meanings.sent3: When Romeo walked into the room, everyone joked about calling him by his own name.
meanings.sent4: His name was like a cloak of romance, fitting for a young man named Romeo.
meanings.sent5: The name Romeo always brought to mind images of star-crossed lovers and tragic endings.
